Key Match Events: Anthony Edwards highlighted a 32-point performance with seven 3-pointers, and the Minnesota Timberwolves beat the New Orleans Pelicans 104-97 on Tuesday night to take some luster off of Zion Williamson's return from a 27-game absence.
Edwards hit four early 3s and had 14 points less than seven minutes in. He surpassed the 30-point mark for the ninth time this season.
Edwards hit a free throw and a pair of 3s during a 19-2, third-quarter run that helped Minnesota turn a 64-57 deficit into a 75-66 lead in less than four minutes. Minnesota did not trail again.
Zion Williamson had 22 points, six rebounds, four assists, three steals and a block in 27 minutes in his seventh game this season.
Dejounte Murray scored 29 points for New Orleans, but CJ McCollum, who scored 50 points just two games earlier, shot 1-of-14 as the Pelicans lost for the 21st time in 24 games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Minnesota led most of the game and by as many as 13 points.
Rudy Gobert had 14 rebounds and six blocks.
The Timberwolves visit Orlando on Thursday. The Pelicans host Portland on Wednesday.
Others: Donte DiVincenzo started at point guard for a second straight night in place of Mike Conley, who was a reserve for just the second time in his 132 games with the Timberwolves. DiVincenzo scored 10 points and Conley eight.

Williamson and Murray worked well together in the first Pelicans game this season with both in the lineup. Twice, a Murray steal resulted in a Williamson breakaway dunk â€” one of them a 360-degree, double-clutch, roundhouse jam.
